ca.uqac.lif.ecp

Class CayleyGraph<T extends Event,U>

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.uqac.lif.ecp.graphs.LabelledGraph<T>
      • ca.uqac.lif.ecp.CayleyGraph<T,U>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of event this graph has for edge labels
    U - The type of the categories in the Cayley Graph
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AtomicCayleyGraph

    public class CayleyGraph<T extends Event,U>
extends LabelledGraph<T>
    Implementation of a Cayley Graph. The vertices of the graph are identified by integers.
    Author:
    Sylvain Hallé

    • Method Detail

      • setLabelFormatter

        public void setLabelFormatter(CayleyGraph.LabelFormatter<U> formatter)

      • getAdjacencyMatrix

        public float[][] getAdjacencyMatrix()
        Produces the adjacency matrix of the Cayley Graph. This matrix is such that entry (i,j) = k if there exist k directed edges from vertex labelled i to vertex labelled j. Although the entries of that matrix are natural numbers, their type is float, as that matrix can be used in algorithms that multiply it by a vector of floats.
        Overrides:
        getAdjacencyMatrix in class LabelledGraph<T extends Event>
        Returns:
        The matrix

        Gets the first vertex that is labelled with a given equivalence class
        Parameters:
        eq_class - The equivalence class
        Returns:
        The first vertex found, null if no vertex exists with that category

      • getClassCardinality

        public java.util.Map<MathSet<U>,java.lang.Integer> getClassCardinality(int length,
                                                                       boolean cumulative)
        Computes the number of traces of a given length that belong to each equivalence class
        Parameters:
        length - The length
        cumulative - If set to true, will compute the number of traces of length at most length (instead of exactly of length length)
        Returns:
        A map telling how many traces there are for each equivalence class

      • isIsomorphicTo

        public boolean isIsomorphicTo(CayleyGraph<T,U> other_graph)
        Determines if some graph is isomorphic to the current graph. The two graphs are isomorphic if there exists a one-to-one mapping between the vertices of the two graphs, such that their labelled transition function is identical modulo this mapping.

        This method is not used for test case generation, but is useful to perform unit tests to check the output of various graph solvers.

        Parameters:
        other_graph - The other graph
        Returns:
        true if they are isomorphic, false otherwise

      • isIsomorphicToThrowable

        public boolean isIsomorphicToThrowable(CayleyGraph<T,U> other_graph)
                                throws CayleyGraph.IsomorphismException
        Same as isIsomorphicTo(CayleyGraph) but throws an exception explaining why the graphs are not isomorphic when they are not.
        Parameters:
        other_graph - The other graph
        Returns:
        true if they are isomorphic, false otherwise
        Throws:
        CayleyGraph.IsomorphismException
